rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment provides a factual statement about trial results without using high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports anticipation and mixed results, lacking explicit calming language.
No bare negation or statement of absence/unlikelihood.
Statement about future attention and past results.
Reports on trial results being "mixed", not prices/metrics.
The segment states results will be watched but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
No direct quotes or clearly attributed statements providing a dominant frame.
Factual reporting of attention level ('closely watched') and data description ('mixed') without explicit framing.
